BMI Categories 
Underweight = smaller than 18.5 
Normal weight = 18.5–24.9 
Overweight = 25–29.9 
Obesity = BMI of 30 or greater 

Your weight is at a high level, it can lead to considerable health problems.Your high body fat mass is likely to have raised your levels of blood pressure and cholesterol and affected the way your body handles blood sugar. 
Overweight and obesity are classified by an individual’s body mass index (BMI). BMI is measured by dividing a person’s weight by their height squared in metres. 

If your body mass index is over 25 then you are overweight and need to start making changes to lose weight. 
The BMI is generally used as a means of correlation between groups related by general mass and can serve as a vague means of estimating adiposity 

Set yourself a target to lose 1 lb-2 lbs (0.5-1 kg) a week, regardless of to what you weigh now. 

 Loosing 500 calories per day times seven days a week = 3500 calories, which is exactly what's in a pound of fat.
